bug.author: CanCanZeng
bug.summary: Compilation error about Eigen in GlobalOptimization.cpp
bug.description:
IMPORTANT: Please use the following template to report the bug. <denchmark-h:hr></denchmark-h>
Describe the bug Compilation Error relates to Eigen in GlobalOptimization.cpp:72:28 when define const std::vector<Eigen::Matrix4d, Matrix4d_allocator> jacobian_operator. To Reproduce Steps to reproduce the behavior:
cmake -DCMAKE_INSTALL_PREFIX='/home/zcc/Project/Work/DenseReconstruction/Offline/Open3D/install' -DBUILD_PYBIND11=OFF -DBUILD_PYTHON_MODULE=OFF -DBUILD_PYTHON_TUTORIALS=OFF .. make See error
Expected behavior A clear and concise description of what you expected to happen. Screenshots If applicable, add screenshots to help explain your problem. Environment (please complete the following information):
OS: Ubuntu 16.04 Python version: 2.7 Open3D version: Is this remote workstation?: no How did you install Open3D?: build_from_source, I tried gcc-4.8 and gcc-5.4

comments.comment: Which commit are you in and have you modified the source code or cmake? Couldn't reproduce the issue from my side. One thing to try is to initialize those Eigen::Matrix4d() matrices outside independently, and then put them in the const std::vector<Eigen::Matrix4d, Matrix4d_allocator> jacobian_operator. I suspect the issue is not this but you can give it a try.

Thank you for your help <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yxlao>@yxlao</denchmark-link> ! I use the default master branch and the commit ID is <denchmark-link:https://github.com/intel-isl/Open3D/commit/af0900bd061d5b29d8a1be517ddbcb0d63164a62>af0900b</denchmark-link>
I have solved the problem now, I build the Eigen in the project and the error gone. The system Eigen version is 3.2.10, maybe it is not compatible with Eigen3.3 Open3D use.

Hi <denchmark-link:https://github.com/yxlao>@yxlao</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/qianyizh>@qianyizh</denchmark-link> , is there any way to produce more accurate model? I followed the tutorial to reconstruct the SceneNN dataset, the model produced seems rather good, but with small noises on the air. How to remove these noises and improve the details of model? I tried to reduce the and , but the result did not change much.

Hi @yxlao @qianyizh , is there any way to produce more accurate model? I followed the tutorial to reconstruct the SceneNN dataset, the model produced seems rather good, but with small noises on the air. How to remove these noises and improve the details of model? I tried to reduce the voxel_size and tsdf_cubic_size, but the result did not change much.
How do you solve this problem finallyï¼Ÿ
